com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.config

Class TempFileOutputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.OutputStream
      • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.config.TempFileOutputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class TempFileOutputStream
extends java.io.OutputStream
    A FileOutputStream wrapper that writes to a temporary file prior to closing the stream and flushing the data to the official output file. It can be used to safely write data to disk without resulting in partially-written data when writing is interrupted.

    Flushing this stream does NOT flush data to the output file, only to the temporary file. If the temporary file stream needs to be closed without replacing the original output file, use close(false).

      • TempFileOutputStream

        public TempFileOutputStream(java.lang.String name)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a new TempFileOutputStream with the output file specified. The temporary file is the output file with .tmp appended.
        Parameters:
        name - of the file to eventually flush the data to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if preparing the temporary file failed

      • TempFileOutputStream

        public TempFileOutputStream(java.io.File outputFile,
                    java.io.File tempFile,
                    java.io.FileOutputStream tempBaseStream)
        Constructs a new TempFileOutputStream with the output file, temporary file and temporary base stream specified. The temporary base stream should be a FileOutputStream pointing to the tempFile parameter.
        Parameters:
        outputFile - to eventually flush the data to
        tempFile - the tempBaseStream is accessing
        tempBaseStream - to write data to before flushing

      • close

        public void close(boolean completeTransfer)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Closes the temporary file stream, writing any pending data to it. If completeTransfer is set, the output file is replaced with the temporary file. Typically, this parameter should specify whether previous writing was successful.
        Parameters:
        completeTransfer - - True to replace the output file, False to preserve it
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - if an I/O error occurs.
